translated: Description of Persons
The mātikā
The two brief expositions

original: Dve puggalā—🔽Kodhano ca, upanāhī ca.🔽Makkhī ca, paḷāsī ca.
analyzed: dve puggalā  kodhanaḥ ca upanāhī ca  makkhī ca paḷāsī ca
translated: Two kinds of persons:🔽angry and malicious;🔽contemptuous and domineering;
envious and stingy;
deceitful and fraudulent;
conscienceless and shameless;

original: Dubbaco ca, pāpamitto ca.🔽Indriyesu aguttadvāro ca, bhojane amattaññū ca.
analyzed: dubbacaḥ ca pāpa mitto ca  indriyesu agutta dvāraḥ ca bhojane amattaññū ca
translated: bad-natured and bad-company;🔽unrestrained in the sense faculties and not moderate in eating;
unmindful and not fully understanding;

analyzed: sīla vipanno ca diṭṭhi vipanno ca
translated: deficient in virtue and deficient in view;

original: Ajjhattasaṁyojano ca, bahiddhāsaṁyojano ca.🔽Akkodhano ca, anupanāhī ca.
analyzed: ajjhatta sayojanaḥ ca bahiddhā sayojanaḥ ca  akkodhanaḥ ca anupanāhī ca
translated: fettered within and fettered without.🔽Not angry and not malicious;

original: Amakkhī ca, apaḷāsī ca.🔽Anissukī ca, amaccharī ca.🔽Asaṭho ca, amāyāvī ca.
analyzed: a makkhī ca a paḷāsī ca  a nissukī ca a maccharī ca  a saṭhaḥ ca a māyāvī ca
translated: not contemptuous and not domineering;🔽not envious and not stingy;🔽not deceitful and not fraudulent;
conscientious and full of moral dread;

analyzed: su vacaḥ ca kalyāṇa mitto ca
translated: well-tempered and having good friends;

original: Indriyesu guttadvāro ca, bhojane mattaññū ca.
translated: restrained in the sense faculties and moderate in eating;
mindful and fully understanding;

original: Sīlasampanno ca, diṭṭhisampanno ca.🔽Dve puggalā dullabhā lokasmiṁ.🔽Dve puggalā duttappayā.
analyzed: sīla sampanno ca diṭṭhi sampanno ca  dve puggalā dullabhā  dve puggalāḥ duttappayā
translated: perfect in virtue and perfect in view.🔽Two kinds of persons are rare in the world.🔽Two kinds of persons are difficult to satisfy.
Two kinds of persons are easy to satisfy.
The effluents of two kinds of persons increase.

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ āsavā na vaḍḍhanti.🔽Hīnādhimutto ca, paṇītādhimutto ca.🔽Titto ca, tappetā ca.
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam āsavāḥ na vaḍḍhanti  hīna adhimuttaḥ ca paṇīta adhimuttaḥ ca  tittaḥ ca tappetā ca
translated: The effluents of two kinds of persons do not increase.🔽One of low resolve and one of noble resolve.
One who is content and one who is discontent.
